summary: The diff implements REQ-36 (manual email/password login and registration system) comprehensively, including backend Motoko functions, frontend login/register pages with tabs, protected routes, and header integration. REQ-37 (comprehensive mobile/responsive pass) shows partial evidence — some pages have responsive classes added — but there is no dedicated, systematic responsive pass across all 15+ required pages with explicit mobile breakpoint handling.

missing_requirements.requirement: Comprehensive mobile and responsive layout pass across ALL pages: Home, Category, ProductDetail, Cart, Checkout, Profile, OrderHistory, Blog, Wholesale, FAQ, ShippingPolicy, Terms, ReturnPolicy, ContactUs, and AdminDashboard — with 320px/768px/1280px breakpoints, 44px touch targets, no overflow, proper product grids, hamburger menu, scrollable modals, etc.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff modifies only a handful of page files (HomePage, OrderHistoryPage, ProfilePage, AdminDashboardPage) and components (Header, Footer). Pages like CategoryPage, ProductDetailPage, CartPage, CheckoutPage, BlogListingPage, BlogPostPage, WholesalePage, FAQPage, ShippingPolicyPage, TermsPage, ReturnPolicyPage, ContactPage are listed only in the file-summaries metadata with brief descriptions and no evidence of responsive-specific changes being applied. There is no systematic pass with documented breakpoint handling across all 15+ required pages.

hallucinated_features.description: A backend migration module (migration.mo) was added to handle schema migration from an old actor state to a new one.
hallucinated_features.reason: The build request did not request a migration module. It only required storing registered user credentials in the Motoko backend. The migration.mo file goes beyond the stated requirements.

hallucinated_features.description: Admin dashboard has a separate inline admin login form that allows admin access without going through the main /login page.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-36 specifies admin login via the manual login form on the login page. The AdminDashboardPage implements a secondary standalone admin login form that bypasses the main login page flow, which was not explicitly requested.
